text:
Raskolnikov sat there, staring at the pillows, lost in thought. “How long will I have to deal with this?” he wondered. “What did I even spend that money on?” He finally broke the silence, eyes fixed on the wall.

“Money? That’s your cash. The messenger brought it from Vahrushin. Your mom sent it. You forgot?” 

“Oh right,” Raskolnikov replied after a long, brooding pause. Razumihin shot him a worried look.

Just then, the door swung open, and a tall, stout guy walked in. Raskolnikov felt like he recognized him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the money sent by his mother while feeling sullen and uneasy.
